Assessment

Class HealthMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Assessment.HealthMonitor

  • public class HealthMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    This program checks the blood pressure, temperature and heart beat rate against the standard values to monitor the health of a patient Each health status tested for have minimum and maximum values. If the value of any is beyond the maximum or minimum, the corresponding alert is set to a condition recorded as a String. But if the values are within range it gives a feedback showing the good condition also as a String.
    Author:
    p15237108(Blessing Alfred)

      • HealthMonitor

        public HealthMonitor(int topValue,
                     int bottomValue,
                     double tempValue,
                     int heartBeatValue)
        Initialises the health monitor with the given value in the format (blood pressure top value, blood pressure bottom value, temperature value, heart beat rate value) and updates the alert.
        Parameters:
        topValue - the top value of the blood pressure.
        bottomValue - the bottom value of the blood pressure.
        tempValue - the temperature value in celsius.
        heartBeatValue - the value of heart beat rate.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        compares this HealthMonitor object to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a HealthMonitor object that has the same blood pressure, temperature and heart beat rate values as the object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare this HealthMonitor object against
        Returns:
        true if the given object represents an HealthMonitor object equivalent to this HealthMonitor object, and false if otherwise.
